Lascelles warming up for [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] in 2014 | fullname = Jamaal Lascelles<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=15 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|11|11|df=y}}<ref name=Hugman>{{Hugman|23774|accessdate=15 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Derby]], England | height = {{convert|1.88|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/jamaal-lascelles-237416/ |title=Jamaal Lascelles |website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=15 February 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | clubnumber = 6 | youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] | years1 = 2011–2014 | clubs1 = [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] | caps1 = 32 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2012 | clubs2 = → [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] (loan) | caps2 = 7 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2014– | clubs3 = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | caps3 = 119 | goals3 = 8 | years4 = 2014–2015 | clubs4 = → [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] (loan) | caps4 = 26 | goals4 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2011 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 8 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2013 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 1 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2014 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 09:06, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Jamaal Lascelles''' ({{IPAc-en|dʒ|ə|ˈ|m|ɑː|l|_|l|ə|ˈ|s|ɛ|l|s}}; born 11 November 1993) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for {{English football updater|NewcastU}} club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].
==Club career== ===Nottingham Forest=== Lascelles was born in [[Derby]], Derbyshire.<ref name=Hugman/> He began his career at [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], progressing through the club's youth system.<ref>{{cite news| title = Arsenal and Spurs target Lascelles heads to Stevenage to gain experience| url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2112883/Arsenal-Tottenham-target-Jamaal-Lascelles-joins-Stevenage-loan.html|newspaper=Daily Mail|location=London| date = 9 March 2012| accessdate = 14 March 2012}}</ref> In January 2011, the club rejected a £5 million offer from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] for him.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thisisnottingham.co.uk/Nottingham-Forest-rejected-163-5m-bid-rookie-defender-Lascelles-January/story-12246464-detail/story.html|title=Nottingham Forest rejected a £5m bid for rookie defender Lascelles in January|date=21 April 2011|newspaper=Nottingham Evening Post|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120210103648/http://www.thisisnottingham.co.uk/Nottingham-Forest-rejected-163-5m-bid-rookie-defender-Lascelles-January/story-12246464-detail/story.html|archivedate=10 February 2012|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| title = Spurs join Arsenal in race for highly-rated Forest hot shot Lascelles| url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2097423/Tottenham-Arsenal-want-Jamaal-Lascelles.html#| newspaper = Daily Mail|location=London| date = 6 February 2012| accessdate = 21 April 2012}}</ref> He signed his first professional contract in March 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thisisnottingham.co.uk/Forest-tie-rising-star/story-12265721-detail/story.html|title=Forest tie up rising young defender Jamaal Lascelles|date=30 March 2011|newspaper=Nottingham Evening Post|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110829224701/http://www.thisisnottingham.co.uk/Forest-tie-rising-star/story-12265721-detail/story.html|archivedate=29 August 2011|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Lascelles made his first-team debut on 31 January 2012, starting in a 2–0 defeat to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref name="Nott'm Forest 0–2 Burnley">{{cite news| title = Nott'm Forest 0–2 Burnley| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16695938 |publisher=BBC Sport| date = 31 January 2012| accessdate = 9 March 2012}}</ref>
====Loan to Stevenage==== In March 2012, Lascelles joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]], on loan until the end of the [[2011–12 in English football|2011–12]] season.<ref name="Boro secure Lascelles loan deal">{{cite news| title = Boro secure Lascelles loan deal| url = http://www.stevenagefc.com/page/LatestNewsDetail/0,,10839~2642621,00.html| publisher = Stevenage F.C.| date = 9 March 2012| accessdate = 9 March 2012| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20120312052242/http://www.stevenagefc.com/page/LatestNewsDetail/0%2C%2C10839~2642621%2C00.html| archive-date = 12 March 2012| dead-url = yes| df = dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="Loan Ranger Lascelles">{{cite news| title = Loan Ranger Lascelles| url = http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/loan-ranger-lascelles-64883.aspx| publisher = Nottingham Forest F.C.| date = 9 March 2012| accessdate = 9 August 2012| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140808051412/http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/loan-ranger-lascelles-64883.aspx| archivedate = 8 August 2014| df = dmy-all}}</ref> He made his debut for Stevenage on 13 March 2012, coming on as a 69th-minute substitute in a 1–0 home win over [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]], playing in the right-back position.<ref>{{cite news|title=Stevenage 1–0 Oldham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17268003|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 March 2012|accessdate=14 March 2012}}</ref> He made his first starting appearance in Stevenage's 6–0 away victory at [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] on 14 April 2012, scoring the club's fourth goal with a header from [[Luke Freeman]]'s cross.<ref name="Yeovil 0–6 Stevenage">{{cite news| title = Yeovil 0–6 Stevenage| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17643247| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 14 April 2012| accessdate = 14 April 2012}}</ref> Lascelles also provided the assist for [[Patrick Agyemang]]'s goal in the same game.<ref name="Yeovil Town 0–6 Stevenage FC">{{cite news|title=Yeovil Town 0–6 Stevenage FC |url=http://www.stevenagefc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10839~58970,00.html |publisher=Stevenage F.C. |date=14 April 2012 |accessdate=14 April 2012 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He remained as a first-team regular from then onwards, playing the remaining four games of the regular season as Stevenage secured a League One play-off spot.<ref name="Stevenage 3–0 Bury">{{cite news| title = Stevenage 3–0 Bury| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17878455| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 5 May 2012| accessdate = 16 May 2012}}</ref> Lascelles also played in both play-off matches, as Stevenage lost 1–0 on aggregate to [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].<ref name="Stevenage 0–0 Sheffield United">{{cite news| title = Stevenage 0–0 Sheffield United| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17971363| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 11 May 2012| accessdate = 16 May 2012}}</ref><ref name="Sheffield United 1–0 Stevenage">{{cite news| title = Sheffield United 1–0 Stevenage| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17980126| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 14 May 2012| accessdate = 16 May 2012}}</ref> He made nine appearances during his two-month loan spell, scoring once.<ref name=sb1112/>
====Return to Nottingham Forest==== On 7 August 2012, Lascelles signed a new four-year contract with Nottingham Forest.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lascelles Pledges Future To Reds|publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C.|url=http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/lascelles-pledges-future-to-reds-297255.aspx|date=7 August 2012|accessdate=9 August 2012|first=Fraser|last=Nicholson}}</ref> He made a total of three appearances in all competitions in the 2012–13 season.<ref name=sb1213/>
Lascelles broke into the starting line-up in the 2013–14 season,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Percy|first1=John|title=Nottingham Forest Jamaal Lascelles handed new deal in a bid to keep him at Nottingham Forest|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/nottingham-forest/10569805/Nottingham-Forest-Jamaal-Lascelles-handed-new-deal-in-a-bid-to-keep-him-at-Nottingham-Forest.html|accessdate=5 August 2014|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|date=13 January 2014}}</ref> forming a central defensive partnership with [[Jack Hobbs (footballer)|Jack Hobbs]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Nottingham Forest hope to fend of Premier League interest in Jamaal Lascelles with new deal|url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/Nottingham-Forest-hope-fend-Premier-League-Jamaal/story-20438991-detail/story.html|accessdate=4 August 2014|newspaper=Nottingham Post|date=14 January 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140910104134/http://www.nottinghampost.com/Nottingham-Forest-hope-fend-Premier-League-Jamaal/story-20438991-detail/story.html|archive-date=10 September 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and making a total of 29 league appearances.<ref name=sb1314/> On 22 January 2014, [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] were fined £45,000 by the FA over an "unauthorised approach" to Lascelles in 2010 while he was still a youth player at Nottingham Forest. Lascelles was warned as to his future conduct.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25843264 |title=Everton fined over approach for Forest's Jamaal Lascelles |date=22 January 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=22 January 2014}}</ref> On 18 March, Lascelles extended his contract in a new four-and-a-half-year deal.<ref>{{cite web|title=Championship: Jamaal Lascelles and Jamie Paterson sign Nottingham Forest deals|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11727/9220801/championship-jamaal-lascelles-and-jamie-paterson-sign-nottingham-forest-deals|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=4 August 2014|date=18 March 2014}}</ref> A reported £4 million bid from [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] was rejected by the club in July.<ref>{{cite web|title=Transfer news: QPR make undisclosed bid for Nottingham Forest defender Jamaal Lascelles|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11727/9369521/transfer-news-qpr-make-undisclosed-bid-for-nottingham-forest-defender-jamaal-lascelles|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=4 August 2014|date=2 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Jamaal Lascelles: Nottingham Forest reject QPR offer|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28159706|accessdate=4 August 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 July 2014}}</ref>
===Newcastle United=== [[File:Newcastle United vs Sheffield Wednesday, 23 September 2015 (10).JPG|thumb|upright|Lascelles playing for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in 2015]]
On 9 August 2014, Lascelles signed a contract with [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], joining on the same day as Forest teammate [[Karl Darlow]]. As part of the deal, both players were loaned back to Nottingham Forest for the [[2014-15 in English football|2014–15]] season.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Marshall|first1=Anthony|title=United Complete Lascelles And Darlow Deal|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20140809/united-complete-lascelles-and-darlow-deal_2281670_4055609|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|accessdate=9 August 2014|date=9 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Magpies swoop for Jamaal and Karl|url=http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/magpies-swoop-for-jamaal-and-karl-1802814.aspx|publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C.|accessdate=9 August 2014|date=9 August 2014}}</ref>
Lascelles returned to Newcastle for the [[2015-16 in English football|2015–16]] season and made his debut for the club on 25 August 2015, against [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Newcastle 4–1 Northampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33970053|accessdate=5 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 August 2015}}</ref> He made his league debut on 3 October, as a substitute in a 6–1 defeat at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Man City 6–1 Newcastle|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34366600|accessdate=5 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 October 2015}}</ref> Lascelles found first-team football hard to come by and did not make his first league start for Newcastle until 23 January 2016, when he played in the 2–1 defeat to Watford, capping his performance with a goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35331083|title=Watford 2–1 Newcastle United|date=23 January 2016|accessdate=4 August 2016}}</ref> Lascelles publicly criticised the mentality of his teammates after a 3–1 loss to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 11 April 2016, questioning their character and desire.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36014870|title=Jamaal Lascelles: Newcastle United need to show character and heart to survive|publisher=BBC Sport|date=11 April 2016|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref> Following injuries to first choice centre-backs [[Chancel Mbemba]] and [[Fabricio Coloccini]], Lascelles was given regular minutes under new manager [[Rafael Benítez]] and gradually stepped up his game, grabbing his second goal for the club in the 3–0 win over [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] on 16 April.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36003773|title=Newcastle United 3–0 Swansea City 0|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 April 2016|accessdate=4 August 2016}}</ref> Lascelles totalled 18 appearances in his first Premier League season, but could not prevent the club getting relegated.
On 4 August 2016, Lascelles was chosen by Benítez to become the new Newcastle United team captain,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20160804/lascelles-appointed-united-captain_2281670_5778951|title=Lascelles Appointed United Captain|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|date=4 August 2016|accessdate=4 August 2016}}</ref> succeeding the departed [[Fabricio Coloccini]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20160804/lascelles-appointed-united-captain_2281670_5778951|title=Newcastle United name Jamaal Lascelles skipper|publisher=Sky Sports News|date=4 August 2016|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref> Benítez had been impressed by Lascelles' willingness to speak up in the dressing room, in particular his criticism of more senior players in the defeat to Southampton.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/09/21/jamaal-lascelles-exclusive-interview-meet-23-year-old-captain|title=Jamaal Lascelles exclusive interview: Meet the 23-year-old captain Rafael Benitez is building his Newcastle United team around|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=21 September 2017|accessdate=6 October 2017 | first=Luke | last=Edwards}}</ref> Despite requiring a double hernia operation, Lascelles played through the pain barrier for the last four months of the [[2016-17 in English football|2016–17]] season,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://en.vavel.com/football/premier-league/newcastle-united/784635-jamaal-lascelles-to-undergo-surgery-after-playing-through-pain-barrier.html|title=Jamaal Lascelles to undergo surgery after playing through pain barrier|newspaper=[[Vavel]]|date=2 May 2016|accessdate=6 October 2017|first=Adam|last=Smith|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171007021427/https://en.vavel.com/football/premier-league/newcastle-united/784635-jamaal-lascelles-to-undergo-surgery-after-playing-through-pain-barrier.html#|archive-date=7 October 2017|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> determined to see the campaign out and ultimately captaining the club to promotion back to the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/05/07/newcastle-crowned-championship-winners-late-jack-grealish-aston/|title=Newcastle crowned Championship winners after late Jack Grealish Aston Villa equaliser halts Brighton|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=7 May 2017|accessdate=6 October 2017 | first=Luke | last=Edwards}}</ref> His solid performances at the beginning of the [[2017-18 in English football|2017–18]] season led to him being nominated for the September [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jamaal-lascelles-nominated-premier-league-13726023|title=Jamaal Lascelles nominated for Premier League Player of the month – here's how you can vote for him|publisher=The Chronicle|date=6 October 2017|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref> which was eventually won by [[Harry Kane]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/tottenham-hotspur/story/3227872/tottenhams-harry-kane-wins-premier-league-player-of-the-month|title=Tottenham's Harry Kane wins Premier League Player of the Month|last=Kilpatrick|first=Dan|website=ESPN|access-date=13 October 2017}}</ref> On 6 October 2017, he signed a new six-year contract with Newcastle, keeping him at the club until 2023.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41529463|title=Jamaal Lascelles: Newcastle United captain signs new contract until 2023|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 October 2017|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref>
In October 2017, he had a training ground fight with teammate [[Mohamed Diamé]]. The two players later apologised and offered to take the entire first-team squad and staff out for lunch.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/10/13/newcastle-pair-say-sorry-training-ground-fight-offer-whole-squad/|title=Newcastle pair say sorry for the training-ground fight and offer the whole squad a free lunch|date=13 October 2017|publisher=|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}}</ref>
In October 2018 he signed a new contract until 2024.<ref>https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46057167</ref>
==International career== Lascelles has represented England at all youth international levels from [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]] to [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]].<ref name="The FA – Jamaal Lascelles">{{cite web| title = The FA – Jamaal Lascelles| url = http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/L/Jamaal%20Lascelles| publisher = The Football Association| accessdate = 9 March 2012}}</ref>
On 28 May 2013, he was named in manager [[Peter Taylor (footballer, born 1953)|Peter Taylor]]'s 21-man squad for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].<ref>[https://archive.is/20130615071407/http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/u20s-world-cup-squad-announcement-280513 "Final squad named"]. The Football Association. 28 May 2013. Retrieved 17 June 2013.</ref> He made his debut on 16 June, in a 3–0 win in a warm-up game against [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay]].<ref>[https://archive.is/20130624222816/http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/uruguay-report-160613 "Training win for Three Lions"]. The Football Association. 16 June 2013. Retrieved 17 June 2013.</ref>
On 27 February 2014, Lascelles received his first [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] call-up for the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification Group 1|2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualifying]] match against [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Nottingham Forest defender Jamaal Lascelles gets first England under-21 call up|url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/Nottingham-Forest-defender-Jamaal-Lascelles-gets/story-20718559-detail/story.html|accessdate=4 August 2014|newspaper=Nottingham Post|date=27 February 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140317062006/http://www.nottinghampost.com/Nottingham-Forest-defender-Jamaal-Lascelles-gets/story-20718559-detail/story.html|archive-date=17 March 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=England Under-21s name 23-man squad for game with Wales|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/under-21/2014/feb/squad-named-for-wales-at-derby-270214|publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=4 August 2014|date=27 February 2014}}</ref> He made his debut, and only under-21 appearance, starting in the qualifying match against [[Moldova national under-21 football team|Moldova]] on 9 September 2014.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Veevers|first1=Nicholas|title=Saido Berahino brace helps England prevail in Moldova|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/under-21/2014/sep/moldova-report-090914|publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=9 September 2014|date=9 September 2014}}</ref>

|7||1||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||2{{efn|Appearances in [[EFL League One play-offs|League One play-offs]]}}||0||9||1 |- |rowspan=5|[[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] |[[2015–16 Newcastle United F.C. season|2015–16]]<ref name=sb1516>{{soccerbase season|60652|2015|accessdate=20 April 2016}}</ref> |[[Premier League]] |18||2||1||0||2||0||colspan=2|—||21||2 |- |[[2016–17 Newcastle United F.C. season|2018–19]]<ref name=sb1819>{{Soccerbase season|60652|2018|accessdate=6 September 2018}}</ref> |Premier League |17||0||0||0||0||0||colspan=2|—||17||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !111||8||4||0||5||0||colspan=2|—||120||8 |- !colspan=3|Career total !176||12||7||0||10||1||2||0||195||13 |}
{{notelist}}
==Honours== '''Newcastle United''' *[[EFL Championship]]: [[2016–17 EFL Championship|2016–17]]<ref name=sb1617/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/tournaments/tournament.sd?tourn_id=1502 |title=Championship: 2016/17: Latest table |website=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref>
'''Individual''' *[[PFA Team of the Year]]: [[PFA Team of the Year (2010s)#Championship 8|2016–17 Championship]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39648483 |title=PFA teams of the year: Chelsea and Tottenham dominate Premier League XI |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2017 |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref>
